name: Xisal_910672_r07_d08_a05_b03
description:
Xisal combines three separate periodic formulae, mappping each one onto a dot-matrix grid with separate ranges and offsets. Noise is taken from circular motion on a 2D noise field with its own radius and offset. These values are mapped onto a range of colours according to one of seven different algorithms, and rotation is added to produce interference patterns with a choice from eight rendering modes.
The initial seed for this loop of 300 frames is 910672, which selects function 5 with offset (-72.0, 0.0), range (6.0, -1.0), and function 3 with offset (-48.0, 1.0), range (0.0, 2.3999996). Noise is produced from sampling points on an ellipse at co-ordinates (60.0, -23.0) with diameters (1.0, 1.0). The three formulae are combined using algorithm 7 with hue values starting at 331 with range 157. The grid is 151 units square.
